title: James Clement (priest)
text: James Orlando Clement was the <a href="Dean%20%28religion%29">Dean</a> of <a href="St.%20George%27s%20Cathedral%2C%20Georgetown">St George's Cathedral</a>, <a href="Georgetown%2C%20Guyana">Georgetown, Guyana</a> from 1976 until 1983. He was <a href="ordained">ordained</a> in 1950 after a period of study at <a href="Codrington%20College">Codrington College, Barbados</a>. He began his ecclesiastical career with a <a href="Curate">curacy</a> in <a href="Montserrat">Montserrat</a> before being appointed <a href="Vicar">Vicar</a> of "St George’s" in the same country in 1952. After further <a href="Vicar">incumbencies</a> in <a href="Anguilla">Anguilla</a>, <a href="Antigua">Antigua</a> and <a href="St%20Kitts">St Kitts</a> he was appointed to a <a href="Guyana">Guyanese</a> parish (Lodge) in 1967. Nine years later he was elected to the <a href="Deanery">Deanery</a> of the <a href="Anglican%20Diocese%20of%20Guyana">Diocese</a>.
